fields.description:
Create landing page to show templates and stacks (Whether this 1 or 2 pages, or tabs will be spec'd in the wireframe)
Create links for associated actions.

comments.body:
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1303

Pls assign to [~jloza] for UX after code review/merge

[~kgill] in Scenario: Properties of each CloudFormation Stack are listed on the landing page can we add to the acceptance criteria what relevant properties for each stack should be seen displayed?
In Scenario: Filtering of CloudFormation Stacks on landing page, can we add what relevant properties to be filtered on should be tested in the acceptance criteria?
Can't complete UX review until create stack works so that I can see the full page

Nice first pass! 

* Please be sure the widgets (MSB etc) above the table/tiles are as shown in the wireframe, I noticed they aren't quite the same yet. 
* Also note that globally, the "x items found" should have the word "items" removed, please. 
* please be sure the displayed status is in english as shown in the wireframe and not in code-speak with dashes and weird capitalizations etc
* status should only be at bottom of tile, not in parameter list as well
THe landing page-reorg is being done in GUI--1472 which is where magic-search updates are happening.

[~jloza], attached screen-shot of instances landing page. I assume it should be changed universally? I notice the tile footer displays without dash, so must be some css foo helping there. I'll look at using that for table status.

fixed in stacks screen..
fixes pushed to GUI-1488 branch (where all the latest stacks fixes live)

Awesome, almost there. Not commenting on org of landing page controls, will do that in the associated ticket.

* English status labels should be sentence case, please. I would have fixed this myself but I couldn't tell where they live. (done)
UX review passed, ready for code review.
[~dkavanagh]: I don't see an open pull request for the changes on GUI-1488.  Please open a PR before submitting this for code review.
[~kgill], not sure if you noticed, but the fixes are all in master, so no PR to review.

[~dkavanagh]: Please avoid pushing your fixes directly to master, which makes it difficult to code review the changes you've made.  Or were all the fixes for this ticket within PR 1303?

/cc [~jloza]

Not sure why you'd assume I pushed fixes directly to master. They were either in the PR above or in a subsequent PR. I had several fixes in other PRs for Stack features. Those were reviewed and merged.
work previously reviewed in merged PRs, so moving to QA

Verified.
